charts_to_render.description: This test uses the axe-core library to check for accessibility issues. Template-level issues repeated across multiple pages are counted only once. To run axe-core on individual web pages, use the axe DevTools browser extension. Rows in the CSV data where 'best-practice' is 'Yes' are just recommendations, and are not strict WCAG failures. Filter the CSV data to show rows where 'best-practice' is equal to 'No' to see actual WCAG failures. In this chart, only strict WCAG failures are counted (where the best-practice column is 'No'). Low scores are good.

This test uses the axe-core library to check for accessibility issues. To run axe-core on individual web pages, use the axe DevTools browser extension. Rows in the CSV data where 'best-practice' is 'Yes' are just recommendations, and are not strict WCAG failures. Filter the CSV data to show rows where 'best-practice' is equal to 'No' to see actual WCAG failures. Low scores are good.
charts_to_render.sql_query: SELECT base_url, SUM(count) AS count_sum FROM cwac_table WHERE organisation LIKE :organisation AND viewport_size LIKE :viewport_size GROUP BY base_url ORDER BY count_sum DESC;

charts_to_render.description: Warning: This is an experimental test, all results should be manually checked. This test has a low false-positive rate, but a high false-negative rate. This test provides indicative information about whether the focus indicator can be visually detected by a machine algorithm when pressing the Tab key. It also detects if a web page is continually animating. Low scores are good.
charts_to_render.sql_query: SELECT base_url, SUM(count) AS count_sum FROM cwac_table WHERE organisation LIKE :organisation AND viewport_size LIKE :viewport_size GROUP BY base_url ORDER BY count_sum DESC;

charts_to_render.description: Warning: This is an experimental test, all results should be manually checked. Failures of this test indicate, but do not confirm, potential WCAG 1.4.10 Reflow failures. This test shows how much x-overflow occurs at a width of 320 CSS pixels. This is a potential indicator of WCAG 1.4.10 Failures, and non-responsive design. Low scores are good.
charts_to_render.sql_query: SELECT base_url, AVG(overflow_amount_px) AS count_sum FROM cwac_table WHERE organisation LIKE :organisation AND viewport_size LIKE :viewport_size GROUP BY base_url ORDER BY count_sum DESC;

charts_to_render.description: This test provides the Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level average for each website. Flesch-Kincaid scores are a way of estimating how easy it is to read a piece of text. For more information, visit Flesch-Kincaid readability tests — Wikipedia A score of ~8 or lower is recommended.
charts_to_render.sql_query: SELECT base_url, AVG(flesch_kincaid_gl) AS gl_avg FROM cwac_table WHERE organisation LIKE :organisation AND viewport_size LIKE :viewport_size GROUP BY base_url ORDER BY gl_avg DESC;

charts_to_render.description: This test provides the Simple Measure of Gobbledygook (SMOG) grade level average for each website. SMOG grade levels are a way of estimating how easy it is to read a piece of text. For more information, visit SMOG — Wikipedia. A score of ~8 or lower is recommended.
charts_to_render.sql_query: SELECT base_url, AVG(smog_gl) AS sum FROM cwac_table WHERE organisation LIKE :organisation AND viewport_size LIKE :viewport_size GROUP BY base_url ORDER BY sum DESC;

Filter the CSV data to show rows where 'best-practice' is equal to 'No' to see actual WCAG failures. In this chart, only strict WCAG failures are counted (where the best-practice column is 'No'). Low scores are good.
